medical_history.chief_complaint: Enlarging subcutaneous nodules on the head, legs, and right hand.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began six weeks prior to the visit with a firm, nontender bump on the medial right shin. Over two weeks, three new bumps appeared on the left pretibial area. Over the next three weeks, these lesions grew in size from 6-10 mm to nearly 20 mm in diameter.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Episodes of bronchiolitis at 6 weeks and 7 months. Transient flat, serpiginous rash at 13 months, presumed viral. Seen by a cardiologist at 16 months for a murmur diagnosed as a flow murmur.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had reddish purple bumps as a child thought to be tinea corporis. Maternal grandmother and mother had heart murmurs. A first cousin had ventricular septal defect and hypoplastic left heart syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with parents and a healthy four-year-old brother. No pets and no recent exposure to domesticated animals. Family has not traveled in the preceding year.
